interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions.
The United States has the world's largest economy by nominal GDP.
India is the world's largest democracy by population.
Germany is known for its engineering excellence and is home to brands like BMW and Mercedes-Benz.
The UK is home to the oldest continuous monarchy in Europe.
Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world.
Mexico is home to the ancient city of Teotihuacan, known for its massive pyramids.
Rome is home to the Vatican, the world's smallest independent state.
South Africa has three capitals: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Argentina is known for its tango dance and music.
Spain has the fourth-highest number of UNESCO World Heritage Sites.
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, the holiest city in Islam.
South Korea is a leader in technology and home to brands like Samsung and Hyundai.
Istanbul is the only city in the world that sits on two continents.
Sweden is known for its welfare system and high quality of life.
The Netherlands is famous for its windmills, tulips, and cycling culture.
